intro: Restio confinis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved restio, is a member of the Restionaceae family, native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb with grass-like foliage, characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and dense, spike-like flower clusters. The plant typically grows in coastal and sandy environments, thriving in well-drained soils. It is often found in fynbos vegetation, contributing to the biodiversity of these ecosystems. Restio confinis is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
